* iv. A credit in favour of Us or the intermediary is made through an electronic medium including the internet.
* b. In the event that the total premium due is not paid to the Us (or the intermediary through whom this Policy or Bond was effected) on or before the inception date or the renewal date, then the insurance shall not attach and no benefits whatsoever shall be payable by Us. Any payment received thereafter shall be of no effect whatsoever as cover has not attached.
* c. Premium Payment
    * i. The payment of the premium when it is due will ensure the continuance of the Policy in force until the next premium is due;
    * ii. This Policy will be renewed upon the payment of the premium when it is due either on a monthly or annual basis as applicable and stated in the Policy Schedule unless prior written notice of cancellation has been given in accordance with General Condition 3 or the Policy has otherwise been terminated.
questions: How does the requirement for premium payment through electronic mediums affect the validity of the policy and what happens if payment is delayed beyond the inception or renewal date?

What are the consequences if the total premium is not received by the insurer or intermediary on or before the policy inception or renewal date, and how does this impact the attachment of insurance coverage?
In what ways does the timing of premium payment influence the continuance of the policy, and what conditions must be met to ensure uninterrupted coverage until the next premium is due?
How does the policy handle renewal upon premium payment, and what role does prior written notice of cancellation or policy termination play in this process?
If a premium payment is made after the inception or renewal date, what is the effect on coverage and benefits, and are there any exceptions to this rule?
What is the significance of the policy schedule in relation to the premium payment frequency and renewal terms, and how does this interact with the insurer's general conditions?
How does the policy define the point at which insurance coverage attaches in relation to premium payment, and what documentation or proof of payment is required to confirm this?
What are the implications for the insured if the policy is not renewed due to non-payment of premium, and how does this affect any claims made during the lapsed period?
How does the policy address situations where the premium is partially paid or credited to the insurer or intermediary, particularly through electronic means?
In the event of a policy cancellation initiated by the insurer or intermediary, how does this affect the premium payment obligations and the effective date of cancellation?
What procedures must be followed for premium payment to be considered valid, and how does the use of electronic payment methods influence these procedures?
How does the policy ensure that the insured is aware of the premium payment due dates, and what are the consequences of failing to meet these deadlines?
What is the relationship between the payment of premium and the insurer’s obligation to provide benefits under the policy, especially in cases of delayed or missed payments?
How does the policy handle renewal and premium payment if the insured opts for monthly versus annual payment schedules, and what conditions apply to each?
What role does the intermediary play in the receipt and processing of premium payments, and how does this affect the attachment of coverage and policy renewal?
How does the policy treat premium payments made through different electronic mediums, and are there any restrictions or conditions on acceptable payment methods?
What are the insurer’s rights and obligations if a premium payment is reversed or refunded after the policy inception or renewal date?
How does the policy coordinate the premium payment requirements with any general conditions related to policy termination or cancellation?
In cases where the policy is renewed upon premium payment, how does the insurer handle situations where a prior written notice of cancellation has been issued?
What are the consequences for the insured if the premium payment is made correctly but the insurer or intermediary fails to acknowledge receipt before the inception or renewal date?
